page.title: 16ALMSHOUSES OF GROVE.
page.content: At the rear of the West End of the Church are two Alms Houses,now in an advanced stage of disrepair.They were established for the village poor before 1685,when Sir Creswell bought the Grove Estate.He gave a Lent Gift of Â£10-8s-0d for the maintainance of two people in the Almshouses.This Charity was eventually lost until the Harcourt Vernons' restored it.The Levinz Trust still remains.Until recently,two spinsters-Misses Jones and Steel- lived in the cottages. Since their deaths,the cottages have remained empty.
